summary.text: Lifetime Consequences for Sex Offenders Act of 2003 - Amends the Federal criminal code to provide for an authorized period of supervised release of any term of years or life for specified offenses, including: (1) kidnapping involving a minor victim; (2) sex trafficking of children by force, fraud, or coercion; (3) sex abuse and aggravated sex abuse; (4) production of sexually explicit depictions of a minor for importation into the United States; (5) transportation of minors with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity or in a sexual act with a juvenile; (6) abusive sexual contact; (7) sexual exploitation of children; (8) selling or buying children; (9) certain activities relating to material involving the sexual exploitation of minors, or material constituting or containing child pornography; and (10) the use of interstate facilities to transmit information about a minor.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
